context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: immediately report the missing cash to his supervisor or the store owner, explaining the situation and demonstrating his commitment to transparency and honesty
contact his boss or supervisor to report the missing money
check the surveillance footage, if there is any, to see if there are any irregularities or if he accidentally gave too much change to a customer
review the day's sales and receipts and cross-reference them with the till in the register to see if there are any discrepancies

review the security footage or transaction records, if available, to understand what might have happened to the missing money

check the security footage, if available, to see if there was any customer or employee theft
report the missing money to the owner or higher authority immediately, explaining the situation and perhaps offering possible explanations or solutions

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
